resources.string: Welcome to the game\'s basics tutorial. Step by step, I\'m going to show you how to play. Press \'Next\' when you\'re ready to begin.
Excellent! First things first. FlipIt is a two-player board game, where one player plays with the black game pieces, and the second player plays with the white ones.
When a game ends, the player who has more game pieces on the board wins.
For example, in that board, the player who played with the black pieces won. Because, there are 51 black pieces and only 13 white ones.
Before we continue, note that just for the purpose of this tutorial, you are going to play with the black game pieces.
Now, let\'s see how to flip your opponent\'s pieces to your advantage.
On your move, the opponent\'s pieces are flipped if they are trapped by the new piece you put on the board. Try to press the glowing square and see.
You can flip pieces in a row, a column and also diagonally. Moreover, you can do all of that simultaneously. Please, go ahead.
Great! Now, you must keep in mind that in each turn, you must flip at least one of your opponent\'s pieces. If you can\'t, your opponent gets another turn.
The game ends when the board is full, or if both players cannot make a legal move.
That would be all. You are now ready to play. Enjoy!
Hey there! If you want to learn more about the game, you came just to the right place.
I’m about to show you several game strategies that will definitely help you win a lot more!
Before we begin, note that just for the purpose of this tutorial, you are going to play with the black game pieces.
Great! So, the first strategy is the simplest one – go for the goal. It means, every turn, try to flip as much game pieces as you can.
In that case, putting a piece on the green glowing spot would be more suitable under this strategy.
Okay. Now, let’s see why this strategy alone is not good enough.
A much better approach for the game would be one that attempts to capture the corners of the board.
You’re probably wondering, what is so great about the corners? Well, for starters, pieces placed in corners will never get flipped.
Here’s an extreme example where your opponent played ‘for the goal’, but will still lose. That’s because he’s out of legal moves and the corners are yours to capture.
Excellent! you are a better player already! Now, let’s observe more areas of the board.
The most dangerous area in the board is around the corners. That’s because capturing them will might give your opponent an opportunity to capture the corners.
Here’s a simple hypothetical example that will show you what I mean. If you would press the orange spot, your opponent will capture the corner.
Great! Let’s get to the next zone – the remainders of the margins. Similarly to the corners, you can notice they are very good spots to capture.
The next area is adjacent to the margins. You might want to avoid that zone, because it can give your opponent an opportunity to gain control over the margins.
So, we’ve seen four areas – two areas that are great to play, and two dangerous ones. That’s leaving us with the last area – the middle of the board, which is mostly neutral.
Excellent! Let’s jump right to the final strategy, which you can use after capturing corners and margins.
You can try to advance from the outer parts of the board to the inside, without spaces between your disks.
That way, you can make more non-flippable pieces. Plus, it will significantly reduce the number of legal moves your opponent will have.
That would be all. You are now ready to dominate the board! Happy gaming!
